results.title: Fishing the lake country
results.creator_credit: Betti Wood, Ossie Emery, ABC and Pilgrim Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt shows some attractive fishing spots in Sydney and Mallacoota before going to the Gippsland Lakes. All through the film he gives hints on fishing, as well as discussing the ups and downs of the sport.

results.title: Fishing on the coast of Japan
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Depicts the rigorous existence of Japanese fisherman. This film is non-narrated with Japanese music serving as the background. Shows the preparation of the nets, men and women pulling the boats into the sea, look outs for fish, the final catch, return home and the unloading. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.brief_description: Surf casting along the Atlantic Coast for bass; trout fishing in the Rockies; fishing for marlin off the Australian coast; tuna fishing in Nova Scotia.

results.title: Fishing across Canada
results.brief_description: Screen Magazine: Herring from the river: fishermen-farmers of the Gasperaux Valley in Nova Scotia catch herring upriver. Fish below the ice: Cree Indians of northern Manitoba fish in wintertime by stringing nets between holes in the ice. Home for young trout: to stock mountain lakes in the Canadian Rockies, fish are raised in hatcheries, the largest in Jasper National Park. Salmon on the run: on Canada’s west coast, commercial fishing vessels haul in huge catches. A glimpse of the of the multi-million-dollar salmon industry of Canada’s west coast.

results.title: Fishing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
Illustrates the fishing methods of the Australian Aborigine. They are shown fishing on a lake, using three-pronged spears from bark canoes. With Bill Onus.

results.title: Fishery in Japan
results.brief_description: Fish plays a large part in the diet of the Japanese people, providing them with much needed protein. It is eaten in various forms, some of which are a delight to the eye as well as the palate. Japan has one of the world’s largest and most efficient fishing industries, all types of fishing operations, coastal and deep-sea, canning and freezing operations are shown.

results.title: Fishermen of Pubnico
results.creator_credit: Victor Jobin, ONF | NFB and Leonard Forest
results.brief_description: A film story about the people who live in the nine fishing villages of Pubnico on the southwest tip of the Nova Scotian peninsula. Like that of their Acadian ancestors, their livelihood is inextricably bound to the sea. Characteristic of their faith in its bounty is the quest of the captain of a fishing schooner who, after a fruitless three-week search for swordfish, borrows money and sets out again. Eight more days of scanning the waves are rewarded by a full catch and money in the pocket for the captain and his crew.

results.title: Fishermen
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: Should he choose to stay boss of his own boat and hope for better catches, or seek a job in commercial fishing, trading independence for a more certain income? This film is about the choice that faces many of Canada’s east-coast fishermen. (Awards: Berlin; Bloemfontein; Columbus)

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Bosustow Entertainment, Churchill Films, Nick Bosustow, C B Wismar and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.
